duties_responsibilities.duty: Collect patient health data and perform initial assessment based on patient's presentation.
Develop a family centered plan of care consistent with the patient's needs and physician's treatment plan.
Document the initial plan of care and provide updates as required.
Evaluate patient's progress toward attainment of outcomes and revise the plan of care as needed.
Communicate with the patient, family, and healthcare providers to promote continuity of care.
Maintain effective interactions with the staff, contribute to the professional development of peers, and engage in performance appraisal.
Participate in the evaluation of the quality and effectiveness of nursing practices and support measures to improve practice.
Maintain knowledge and proficiency in the clinical area and age group served through learning and professional development activities.

education_certification.credential: Professional knowledge of nursing theory and practice acquired through completion of a two-year training at an accredited School of Nursing.
Current New York State license or Permit as a Registered Professional Nurse.
ACLS certification for ICU and Float pool.
Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.
